title: Refactor and fix bugs in `utils::content_safe`

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body:
Besides the various `content_safe::clean_{mentions,roles,users}` being kind of spaghetti in quality, they also contained a subtle bug. For example, a malicious user could pass the string `<@&<@1234>` to be cleaned, and only the outer-most pairs of angle brackets would be chosen for parsing. This would incorrectly leave the mention unparsed, and let it through the filter. This PR fixes that bug by parsing between the inner-most pairs of angle brackets instead.

Additionally, replace specific parsing logic for each type of mention by instead parsing into the `Mention` enum by implementing `FromStr` for it, to reduce code duplication.  Furthermore, instead of replacing within the original string, which is prone to bugs (as we were shortening/lengthening the string while iterating over it), this builds a new string piece by piece, which also saves on re-allocations and strcpy usage.

Finally, mentions that contain numeric-strings too large to fit into a `u64` are now ignored, as although the discord client regex-es them, the API itself doesn't care. It is unlikely they will ever be considered valid mentions. Ignoring them cuts down on required bookkeeping and improves performance.

As a note, I moved `Mention` and `Mentionable` into their own module, and kept that as a separate commit, since I think the changes can stand on their own. I also removed `utils::parse_mention` as it is no longer used.

Removals:

For any non-`Copy` types, remove the implementation of `From<&'_ T> for Mention`, as these types all impelement `Mentionable`, so users can just call `T::mention()` instead. labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body: Using a custom trait to create `Content` is unnecessary; From/Into serve just as well. Also, we don't implement `Into<Content> for ContentModifier` as it's essentially useless to include a `ContentModifier` by itself in a message. The various implementations of `Add` take care of coercion for us, and the various `push_{modifier}` methods can take empty strings either way.

title: Bump to 0.11.0
body:
This prepares for the release of `0.11.0` by updating the `CHANGELOG.md` file and updating the version in relevant places.

This marks the end of the `v0.10.x` series and the beginning of the `v0.11.x` series. It includes a multitude of breaking changes, small and huge, and lots more of other additions, fixes, and removals.

With this, development on the `current` branch has stalled and won't be accepting additions for `v0.10.x`, instead they will be redirected to `v0.11.0`. After `v0.11.0` is released on https://crates.io, the `current` and `next` branches will wrap around, with `next` becoming the new `current` and `current` the new `next`.

Notable changes include:

- Removal of deprecated and unused things
- Removal of tokio `0.2` compatiblity
- Changing the cache to be synchronous
- Increasing the MSRV to 1.53
- Reorganisation of types into separate modules
- Improving perfomance and quality of deserialise implementations
- Requiring specifying gateway intents
- Making `chrono` an optional dependency (but is still turned on by default)
- Simplifying the `Http` API
- Stabilising application commands (i.e. `unstable_discord_api` is no longer necessary)
- Support for attachments when creating and updating followup messages

The full, unsullied changelog for the release that will be put on Github's releases is:

title: feat: set `Http::application_id` in ready event handler
body: This PR modifies `Shard` so that it overwrites the HTTP application id when it receives a ready payload. This is useful so that you do not have to save the application id in the environment too instead of just the token. I'm not sure if it is the best implementation but I have tested it and it seems to work.

title: Enable compilation of builder/interaction code without a backend
body:
I have a somewhat odd use case. I wanted to create an Interactions webhook receiver using Cloudflare Workers. Their platform does not support native executables; rather you get a web-ish JS/WASM environment. This means bringing your own networking tools isn't in the cards, as there is no interface to use.

Still, I didn't want to reinvent the wheel and re-type (the parts I needed out of) the Discord API. Instead, I wanted to use the existing types provided by Serenity, even if I couldn't actually use the HTTP or gateway code (I didn't need those for this project). However, I found that selecting just the features I wanted, i.e. `builder` and `unstable_discord_api`, would result in compiler errors throughout the code. I worked through those and added (in my eyes) appropriate feature gates to ensure no change to existing users, while enabling my intended configuration to compile without error.

In future, I would like to perhaps explore the possibility of using Reqwest's support for the Fetch API and a manual rewrite of the WebSocket code to enable the full feature set of Serenity in an environment like that.

title: Rename the enum sub types of the audit log actions

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
The enums represent different action types and not different entity types.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
The `audit_log::Action*` enum sub types are renamed to `*Action`. Like
`ActionChannel` to `ChannelAction`.

title: Make the `model::guild::audit_log` module public
body:
The `audit_log` module contains a lot of types which clutter the
`guild` module but are probably not used by most serenity users.

The types are still re-exported by the `guild` module but hidden from
the documentation.

title: refactor: make collector builders synchronous

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
This removes the `Future` implementations for `ComponentInteractionCollectorBuilder`, `EventCollectorBuilder`, `MessageCollectorBuilder`, `ModalInteractionCollectorBuilder` and `ReactionCollectorBuilder` and replaces it with a synchronous build method because there is nothing that requires it to be async.

Because the code inside some macros needed to be changed from `impl<'a> $name<'a>` to `impl $name`, this also changes the `BoxFuture` of related structs to be static, making them owned types.

Related PRs: #1538, #1566

title: Fix usage of builder pattern across code, docs, and examples

labels.name: framework
labels.description: Related to the `framework` and `framework::standard` modules and/or the `command_attr` crate

body: I went through and grepped for uses of the builder pattern across the codebase and corrected it where it wasn't being used ergonomically.

title: Add missing method for converting to a ModalSubmitInteraction
body: While working with the new Modal features, I noticed that the method for converting an `Interaction` to a `ModalSubmitInteraction` was missing. Here's a PR to address this, please let me know if I need to modify anything in my code or PR.

title: Clarify docs for using components with webhooks
body: In #1758 I left out a notice in the docs about restrictions around using components with webhooks, specifically that the webhook needs to be owned by an application. This PR changes them to reflect that.

title: Add components support to ExecuteWebhook and EditWebhookMessage
body: Adds `ExecuteWebhook::{components, set_components}`, as well as `EditWebhookMessage::components`, which all have the same implementation as the corresponding methods on `CreateMessage` and others. Note, per the Discord API these are only valid to call on an application-owned webhook, so I introduced code to verify at runtime whether or not the usage is valid by looking at the webhook's kind.

title: Support more options for querying invites

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
As I outlined in #1712, there's a few possible ways to handle the new parameters Discord is offering; I've just gone with the one I personally favor, but am happy to change it.

Fixes #1712

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

labels.name: framework
labels.description: Related to the `framework` and `framework::standard` modules and/or the `command_attr` crate

title: Fix the mapping of the `Change::Type` variant

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body:
The field can be either a string or an integer for the type of the entity.

Follow-up to: #1746

title: Change the data mapping of `AuditLogs`

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
The `entries` are now mapped as `Vec` to keep the order as returned by
the Discord API (newest first). The fields `users` and `webhooks` are
mapped as `HashMap<ID, ENTITY>` to lookup the entities that are
referenced by the audit log entries.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**
- The field `AuditLogs::entries` is changed to `Vec<AuditLogEntry>`.
- The fields `users` and `webhooks` are changed to `HashMap<ENTITY_ID, ENTITY>`.

title: Basic forum channels
body:
This PR adds rudimentary support for Discord's experimental forum channels. This is needed because serenity currently fails to cache guilds with forum channels due to the unknown channel type, which can break bots.

As seen in the list of commits, the changes are:
- Added forum channel type
- Handle forum channel type in deserialization
- Skip invalid channel when caching - caching should be resilient against Discord adding new channel types in the feature
- Gate forum channels behind unstable_discord_api - forum channels are still experimental

title: Fix serialization of the role/user ID in `PermissionOverwrite`

labels.name: fix
labels.description: A solution to an existing bug.

body:
The `RoleId`/`UserId` serialization has been circumvented and the IDs have been
serialized as integers instead of strings.

title: Move the audit log serde modules into its own `utils` module
Add method to pass `EventHandler` in an `Arc` directly to the `Client`
body: Some users (me) might need a handle to the `EventHandler`, even after it's moved into the client. By accepting it as a normal `Arc`, you can do this.

title: Remove GuildChannel send_message note
body: This pull request removes an inaccurate comment from the documentation for Guild Channel's send_message function.

title: Rework the audit log serde module for optional integer strings

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
- Serialize value as string
- Implement `Visitor::visit_unit` for the `simd-json` support
- Self-contained imports
- Reduce indentation of the `Visitor` implementation

**BREAKING CHANGE:** The optional integer values are now serialized as
strings to follow Discord's format.

title: Change the audit log `Change` struct into an enum with the actual types

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
The new enum covers the currently documented keys and has a catch-all variant
`Other { name, old, new }` to deal with unknown keys.

Introduces `serde_value::Value` as intermediary data for deserialization.
`serde_test` fails to verify the test tokens because of differences in
(de)serialization process when `json::Value` is used.

Error message: "tokens failed to deserialize: \
                invalid type: newtype struct, expected any valid JSON value"

`serde_value::Value` is similar to the type that is used by `serde` to
buffer untagged or internally tagged enums but is sadly not part of the
public API.

**BREAKING CHANGE:** The audit log type `model::guild::Change` is now an
enum with variants for the currently reported keys.

title: Fix reference to kankyo::load() in e06 .env.example
body: `.env.example` in example 6 talks about `kankyo::load()` when kankyo is nowhere to be seen in any of the code. I changed this to `dotenv::dotenv()`, which it seems like is the correct function.

title: Cache result from to_* functions
body: This just adds the result of `to_user` and `to_channel` to the cache.

title: Add modal submit collector
body:
This PR adds a collector for modal submit interactions.

`src/collector/modal_interaction_collector.rs` is mostly a copy of `src/collector/message_component_collector.rs`. The main difference ist, that Message for modal interactions is optional.

 [x] Test: https://github.com/pascalharp/serenity_modal_collector_testing

title: Add `GenericId` snowflake type for unspecific entities in audit logs

labels.name: breaking change
labels.description: The public API is changed, resulting in miscompilations or unexpected new behaviour for users

body:
It's not the only usage for such a type. 
It will also be used in a following PR that replaces the `Change` struct with an enum with different variants for the keys.

**BREAKING CHANGE:** The field `id` of the optional audit entry info type
`model::guild::Options` changed to `Option<GenericId>`.

title: feat: add set_components
body: Added `set_components` to `EditMessage` the same as in `CreateMessage` to archive parity between the two builders.

title: Add support for API v10
body:
Completed:
- [x] Version change
- [x] Add message content intent
- [x] `application.summary` now returns an empty string. This field will be removed in `v11`
- [x] `/channels/:channel_id/threads/active` has been removed
- [x] Existing `attachments` must be specified when `PATCH`ing messages with new attachments. Any attachments not specified will be removed and replaced with the specified list
- [x] Audit log `reason` as a body/query parameter is no longer supported, and you should instead use the `X-Audit-Log-Reason` header.
- [x] Message routes accept `embeds` rather than `embed`
- [x] Requests to `v10` and higher will no longer be supported on `discordapp.com`

title: Add support to set a single child builder for several parent builders
body:
- Implement a simple 'embed' function for 'CreateInteractionResponseData' and 'CreateInteractionResponseFollowup' builders, similar to 'set_embed' for 'CreateMessage' builder
- Implement a simple 'set_action_row' function for 'CreateComponents' builder, similar to 'set_embed' for 'CreateMessage' builder

title: Add `message_id` field to audit log options for pinned/unpinned messages
body: See https://github.com/discord/discord-api-docs/blob/master/docs/resources/Audit_Log.md#optional-audit-entry-info

title: Replace deserialization helper functions with the required types
body: The rust compiler is able to infer the hashmap/vec types.

title: Implement `serde` traits for the audit `Action` enum directly
body:
The transmutation of the `u8` value during the deserialization is now
extracted into `Action::from_value` and covered with the tests.
